question: This paragraph is from the Reserve Bank of Australia. Does it describe Australian inflation (i.e. home-country inflation)?

above_target.question: Is inflation expected to remain above target for an extended period of time?

yes.assessment: Hawkish (Sustained high inflation requires tightening policies)

no.assessment: Leaning Hawkish (inflation is above target but returning, implies caution but not necessarily long-term tightening)

on_target.question: Are there any inflationary or disinflationary risks discussed?

inflationary risks discussed.assessment: Leaning hawkish (inflation is within the target range, but inflationary pressures are a risk).

disinflationary risks discussed.assessment: Leaning dovish (inflation is within the target range, but disinflationary pressures are a risk).

not discussed.assessment: Neutral (Inflation within target range indicates a balanced approach)

below_target.question: Is inflation expected to remain below target for an extended period of time?

yes.assessment: Dovish (Sustained below-target inflation warrants easing policies)

no.assessment: Leaning Dovish (Current below-target inflation implies caution and potential easing)
